data.Sentence_cn: 是否可笑?
data.Sentence: --- lesson 29  Funny or not?

data.Sentence_cn: 我们觉得一则笑话是否好笑，很大程度取决于我们是在哪儿长大的。
data.Sentence: Whether we find a joke funny or not largely depends on where we have been brought up.

data.Sentence_cn: 幽默感与民族有着神秘莫测的联系。
data.Sentence: The sense of humour is mysteriously bound up with national characteristics.

data.Sentence_cn: 譬如，法国人听完一则俄国笑话可能很难发笑。
data.Sentence: A Frenchman, for instance, might find it hard to laugh at a Russian joke.

data.Sentence_cn: 同样的道理，一则可以令英国人笑出泪来的笑话，俄国人听了可能觉得没有什么可笑之处。
data.Sentence: In the same way, a Russian might fail to see anything amusing in a joke which would make an Englishman laugh to tears.

data.Sentence_cn: 大部分令人发笑的故事都是根据喜剧情节编写的。
data.Sentence: Most funny stories are based on comic situations.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管民族不同，有些滑稽情节却能产生普遍的效果。
data.Sentence: In spite of national differences, certain funny situations have a universal appeal.

data.Sentence_cn: 比如说，不管你生活在哪里，你看查理.卓别林的早期电影很难不发笑。
data.Sentence: No matter where you live, you would find it difficult not to laugh at, say, Charlie Chaplin's early films.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而，近来一种新式幽默流行了起来，这种幽默主要来自美国。
data.Sentence: However, a new type of humour, which stems largely from the U.S., has recently come into fashion.

data.Sentence_cn: 它被叫作“病态幽默”。
data.Sentence: It is called 'sick humour'.

data.Sentence_cn: 喜剧演员根据悲剧情节诸如暴死，重大事故等来编造笑话。
data.Sentence: Comedians base their jokes on tragic situations like violent death or serious accidents.

data.Sentence_cn: 许多人认为这种笑话是低级庸俗的。下面是个“病态幽默”的实例，你可以据此自己作出判断。
data.Sentence: Many people find this sort of joke distasteful. The following example of 'sick humour' will enable you to judge for yourself.

data.Sentence_cn: 圣诞节前几周，某人摔断了右腿被送进医院。
data.Sentence: A man who had broken his right leg was taken to hospital a few weeks before Christmas.

data.Sentence_cn: 从他进医院那一刻时，他就缠住医生，让医生告诉他什么时候能回家。
data.Sentence: From the moment he arrived there, he kept on pestering his doctor to tell him when he would be able to go home.

data.Sentence_cn: 他十分害怕在医院过圣诞。
data.Sentence: He dreaded having to spend Christmas in hospital.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管医生竭力医治，但病人恢复缓慢。
data.Sentence: Though the doctors did his best, the patient's recovery was slow.

data.Sentence_cn: 圣诞节那天，他的右腿还上着石膏，
data.Sentence: On Christmas Day, the man still had his right leg in plaster.

data.Sentence_cn: 他在床上郁郁不乐地躺了一天，想着他错过的种种欢乐。
data.Sentence: He spent a miserable day in bed thinking of all the fun he was missing.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而，第二天，医生安慰他说，出院欢度新年的可能性还是很大的，
data.Sentence: The following day, however, the doctor consoled him by telling him that his chances of being able to leave hospital in time for New Year celebrations were good.

data.Sentence_cn: 那人听后振作了精神。果然，除夕时他可以一瘸一拐地去参加晚会了。
data.Sentence: The man took heart and, sure enough, on New Years' Eve he was able to hobble along to a party.

data.Sentence_cn: 为了补偿住院这一段不愉快的经历，那人喝得稍许多了一点。
data.Sentence: To compensate for his unpleasant experiences in hospital, the man drank a little more than was good for him.

data.Sentence_cn: 在晚会上他尽情娱乐，一再告诉大家他是多么讨厌医院。
data.Sentence: In the process, he enjoyed himself thoroughly and kept telling everybody how much he hated hospitals.

data.Sentence_cn: 晚会结束时，他嘴里还在嘟哝着医院的事，突然踩到一块冰上滑倒了，摔断了左腿。
data.Sentence: He was still mumbling something about hospitals at the end of the party when he slipped on a piece of ice and broke his left leg.
